content: Does anyone have access to a public synthetic or deidentified Australian "My Health Record" that they could share? I don't mean an HTML rendering, I mean an actual XML or JSON or whatever format it is stored and transmitted in.
I'm guessing you'd like a Shared Health Summary? There is a variety of documents it accepts: https://www.nehta.gov.au/implementation-resources/clinical-documents

@Vadim Peretokin Thank you. In particular this spec (https://www.nehta.gov.au/implementation-resources/clinical-documents/shared-health-summary) is what I'm after... but no complete examples are included in the ZIP.
there should be examples in a related download
@Jason Walonoski could you let me know what do you need it for, so we can get you what you're after?

I want something similar for the USA (where I live). I want to get into the nuts and bolts of what is actually in there and how it is represented... CDA according to the spec you pointed me to. I want to compare the data in the Australian Shared Health Summary with FHIR $everything and what is in DAF... I want to have an idea what should be in a similar record for the United States. The spec lists a lot of data, but I wonder what information is in there in actual practice (which was why I was asking for a good synthetic or deidentified record).
